column1: #Text=Polycrystalline SmCrO3 samples were compounded by the conventional solid-state reaction method with high-purity (>99.99%) raw powders of Sm2O3, and Cr2O3.
#Text=The powders were mixed and grounded in an agate mortar and then sintered at 1400 ℃ in air for 12 h repeatedly.
#Text=Then the disk samples with 8 mm in diameter and about 1.0 mm in thickness were pressed.
#Text=After sintered at 1450 °C in air for another 12 h, a cooling-down treatment to room temperature with furnace was followed before the end of process.
#Text=Powder x-ray diffraction (XRD) measurements were performed on a Bruker D5 diffractometer using Cu-Kα radiation.

#Text=X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns were obtained from 10 to 120 with steps of 0.02 and a counting time of 2 s per step using X-ray diffractometer with Cu Ka radiation (λ = 1.5418 Å) at 40 kV and 40 mA.
